title: A’ Design Awards & Competition – Call for Entries
description: This article has been brought to you by A’ Design Award and Competition. A’ Design Award & Competition is the Worlds’ leading design accolade reaching design enthusiasts around the world, and showcasing award winners from 139 different design disciplines. A’ Design Award winning works are translated into all major languages to connect design lovers, press […]
author: Erin
excerpt: A’ Design Award & Competition is the Worlds’ showcases award winners from 139 different design disciplines.
text: This article has been brought to you by A’ Design Award and Competition. A’ Design Award & Competition is the Worlds’ leading design accolade reaching design enthusiasts around the world, and showcasing award winners from 139 different design disciplines. A’ Design Award winning works are translated into all major languages to connect design lovers, press members, and design buyers from across the globe. You can enter your design, here. Norm Hotel by Hayato Ishii. Photography by Taishiro Sato. Find out more here. The A’ Design Award and Competition offer a unique system for designers to sell their winning ideas to sponsor companies, likewise, the companies can bid for the competing design ideas and make offers to buy the designs. To see the benefits for winners – click here. Jian Shan Jian Shui Packaged Liquor by Jing Chen. Photography by Jing Chen. Find out more here. The system also provides an online exhibition system and creates free profile pages for designers, innovators, and companies, this system is always on and whether you win or not, you will have full access to the system. Radiance of Nature with Urushi Lighting by Yu Watanabe. Photography by Yu Watanabe. Find out more here. This is an interactive system where you can write your biography or corporate profile, create an extensive online portfolio by adding additional designs and exhibit new designs or products. Royal One Private Club House by Kris Lin. Photography by Cheng Ming. Find out more here. A’ Design Award and Competitions are organized and awarded annually in a wide range of categories that include: Good Industrial Design Award, Good Architecture Design Award, Good Product Design Award, Good Communication Design Award, Good Service Design Award, and the Good Fashion Design Award. You can see all of the award categories – here. Rin Display Shelf by Misaki Kiyuna. Photography by Misaki Kiyuna. Find out more here. Some additional benefits you will receive as a winner of the ‘A Design Award and Competition is the inclusion in the exhibition and yearbook, receive publicity through an extensive PR campaign (magazine and blog promotion), be included in the world design rankings, receiving feedback notes by the Jury and score sheet. The Opposite Multi-wear Fashion Collection by Yishu Yan. Photographer: Joseph, Raysee Media/ Model: Sofia Korobova. Find out more here. You will also receive an awards trophy, and the option to sell your winning design and sales listings. Not to mention that you will also receive two invitations to the gala night event. See a list of all of the prizes – here. Lydia Chair by Weiqiang Yao. Photography by Weiqiang Yao. Find out more here. Entries will be judged by an international jury panel of academics, design professionals, and members of the press. Yinchuang Zhong Shu Ge Book Store by Masato Kure and Masashi Ota. Photography by Inter mountain. Find out more here. Let’s take a look at more winning designs from past years… Arcteryx Sanlitun Flagship Store by Arcteryx and Still Young. Photography by Yuuuun Studio. Find out more here. Cascading Canyon Art Installation by Aditi Anuj. Photography by Aditi Anuj. Find out more here. Pet Resource Center Animal Care Building by Rania Alomar. Photography by Ralf Strathmann. Find out more here. Omni Multifunctional Chair by Chenyang Yu and Xinyi Huang. Photography by Xinyi Huang and Chenyang Yu. Find out more here. Ruby Washbasin Series by Creavit Design Team. Photography by Creavit Design Team. Find out more here. The Conequeror Lamp by Kezia Age. Photography by Kezia Age. Find out more here. Open Work Architectural Pavilion by Melek Zeynep Bulut. Photography by Taran Wilkhu, OpenWork. Find out more here. To be part of the A’ Design Award and Competition you can register – here. They also have information in a variety of languages – here.Learn more about A’ Design Award and Competition – here. The deadline for submissions is February 28th, 2025, with the winners and results announced to the public and posted on CONTEMPORIST on May 1st, 2025. contemporist has partnered with A’ Design Award and Competition to bring you this editorial feature
html:
This article has been brought to you by A’ Design Award and Competition.

A’ Design Award & Competition is the Worlds’ leading design accolade reaching design enthusiasts around the world, and showcasing award winners from 139 different design disciplines.

A’ Design Award winning works are translated into all major languages to connect design lovers, press members, and design buyers from across the globe. You can enter your design, here.

Norm Hotel by Hayato Ishii. Photography by Taishiro Sato. Find out more here.

The A’ Design Award and Competition offer a unique system for designers to sell their winning ideas to sponsor companies, likewise, the companies can bid for the competing design ideas and make offers to buy the designs. To see the benefits for winners – click here.

Jian Shan Jian Shui Packaged Liquor by Jing Chen. Photography by Jing Chen. Find out more here.

The system also provides an online exhibition system and creates free profile pages for designers, innovators, and companies, this system is always on and whether you win or not, you will have full access to the system.

Radiance of Nature with Urushi Lighting by Yu Watanabe. Photography by Yu Watanabe. Find out more here.

This is an interactive system where you can write your biography or corporate profile, create an extensive online portfolio by adding additional designs and exhibit new designs or products.

Royal One Private Club House by Kris Lin. Photography by Cheng Ming. Find out more here.

A’ Design Award and Competitions are organized and awarded annually in a wide range of categories that include: Good Industrial Design Award, Good Architecture Design Award, Good Product Design Award, Good Communication Design Award, Good Service Design Award, and the Good Fashion Design Award. You can see all of the award categories – here.

Rin Display Shelf by Misaki Kiyuna. Photography by Misaki Kiyuna. Find out more here.

Some additional benefits you will receive as a winner of the ‘A Design Award and Competition is the inclusion in the exhibition and yearbook, receive publicity through an extensive PR campaign (magazine and blog promotion), be included in the world design rankings, receiving feedback notes by the Jury and score sheet.

The Opposite Multi-wear Fashion Collection by Yishu Yan. Photographer: Joseph, Raysee Media/ Model: Sofia Korobova. Find out more here.

You will also receive an awards trophy, and the option to sell your winning design and sales listings. Not to mention that you will also receive two invitations to the gala night event. See a list of all of the prizes – here.

Lydia Chair by Weiqiang Yao. Photography by Weiqiang Yao. Find out more here.

Entries will be judged by an international jury panel of academics, design professionals, and members of the press.

Yinchuang Zhong Shu Ge Book Store by Masato Kure and Masashi Ota. Photography by Inter mountain. Find out more here.

Let’s take a look at more winning designs from past years…

Arcteryx Sanlitun Flagship Store by Arcteryx and Still Young. Photography by Yuuuun Studio. Find out more here.
Cascading Canyon Art Installation by Aditi Anuj. Photography by Aditi Anuj. Find out more here.
Pet Resource Center Animal Care Building by Rania Alomar. Photography by Ralf Strathmann. Find out more here.
Omni Multifunctional Chair by Chenyang Yu and Xinyi Huang. Photography by Xinyi Huang and Chenyang Yu. Find out more here.
Ruby Washbasin Series by Creavit Design Team. Photography by Creavit Design Team. Find out more here.
The Conequeror Lamp by Kezia Age. Photography by Kezia Age. Find out more here.
Open Work Architectural Pavilion by Melek Zeynep Bulut. Photography by Taran Wilkhu, OpenWork. Find out more here.

To be part of the A’ Design Award and Competition you can register – here. They also have information in a variety of languages – here.

Learn more about A’ Design Award and Competition – here.

The deadline for submissions is February 28th, 2025, with the winners and results announced to the public and posted on CONTEMPORIST on May 1st, 2025.

contemporist has partnered with A’ Design Award and Competition to bring you this editorial feature
